author: Staff Reporter
text:
MahilaCourt Judge Vijayakumari on Tuesday sentenced a man and his mother to undergo seven years imprisonment for harassing his wife that led to her committing suicide in 2011.

The prosecution case was that K. Ravikumar of Manivilundan North in Thalaivasal block was married to Gowri (30). But Ravikumar and his mother Chellamal (68) harassed her to bring money from her parents and beat her. On January 2, 2011, she consumed poison and died at her residence. The Thalaivasal police registered a case under Section 174 CrPC (Poisoning). Later, the sections were altered as 498 (A) (husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty) and 304B (dowry death) of IPC. The case was under trial in the court. The judge found both guilty of the crime and sentenced them to seven years imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs. 2,000 on them. Later, Ravikumar was lodged at Coimbatore Central Prison while Chellamal at Vellore Central Prison.
title: Two get seven years imprisonment
